data.text:
LinkedIn and 3rd parties use essential and non-essential cookies to provide, secure, analyze and improve our Services, and to show you relevant ads (including professional and job ads) on and off LinkedIn. Learn more in our Cookie Policy.

Select Accept to consent or Reject to decline non-essential cookies for this use. You can update your choices at any time in your settings.

NOVEMBER 20th -> Karl von Frisch-1886 Chemical & visual perception of fish and bees; Nobel Prize (medicine), 1973. -> Arieh Warshel-1940 Computational biophysical chemistry; Nobel Prize, 2013. NOVEMBER 21st -> Vladimir Nikolaievich Ipatieff-1867 High-pressure catalysis; terpenes; petroleum chemistry. -> Hieronymus Theodor Richter-1824 Codiscoverer of indium (In, element 49). NOVEMBER 22nd -> Andrew Fielding Huxley-1917 Co-discoverer of ionic mechanism of neural conductance; grandson of biologist Thomas Henry Huxley; Nobel Prize (Medicine), 1963. -> The Manned Spacecraft Center (now the Johnson Space Center announced a process to extract water and oxygen from moon soil, 1970. NOVEMBER 23rd -> Rachel Fuller Brown-1898 Co-discoverer of the fungicide nystatin (US patent 2,797,183), the first antibiotic used effectively to treat human fungal infections. -> William G. Kaelin Jr-1957 Oxygen sensing in cells, Nobel Prize (medicine), 2019. ->Henry Gwyn Jeffreys Moseley-1887 Discovered that X-ray emission frequency is related to atomic number of elements. -> Johannes Diderik van der Waals-1837 Equation of state for non-ideal gases (van der Waals equation), intermolecular interactions (van der Waals forces), electrolytic dissociation, capilarity; Nobel Prize (Physics), 1910. NOVEMBER 24th -> Robert Banks-1921 Polyethylene and polypropylene (US patent 2,825,721). Publication of Charles Darwin's seminal work on evolution by natural selection, On the Origin of Species, 1859. Not a chemistry event, but surely an epochal event in science.
